info.sourceTextContent: Iba el jinete colorado, no como un pimiento, sino como una fresa, encendimiento propio de personas linfáticas. Por ser joven y de miembros delicados, y por no tener pelo de barba, pareciera un niño, a no desmentir la presunción sus trazas sacerdotales. Aunque cubierto de amarillo polvo que levantaba el trote del jaco, bien se advertía que el traje del mozo era de paño negro liso, cortado con la flojedad y poca gracia que distingue a las prendas de ropa de seglar vestidas por clérigos.
info.suspiciousTextContent: Colorado was a rider; not as a pepper, but rather as a strawberry, giving individuals their own inspirations. The youngest and most sensitive, the children, seemed to not refute the religious traces. Although the waiter was covered with yellow dust, raised from the trotting of a pony, his uniform was finely-tailored black cloth. It was loosely cut, and had a grace which distinguishes the clothes of the servants of the church
